intro: Palicourea tachirensis, commonly known as the Tachirean moonseed, is a climbing shrub native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves and small, white to yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruits are capsules that contain tiny seeds, and it often grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
